wikipedia_page.main: Yolanda Faye Brown (born 1982/1983) is a British saxophonist, composer and broadcaster.

response: The current main presenters are Aled Jones, Katherine Jenkins, Sean Fletcher, Kate Bottley, Brenda Edwards, Claire McCollum, JB Gill, Katie Piper, Laura Wright, Pam Rhodes, Gemma Hunt, James Lusted, YolanDa Brown, and Radzi Chinyanganya., BBC Songs of Praise website. *Best Jazz Act: YolanDa Brown

* Rick Astley covered the song for his 1988 album Hold Me in Your Arms, and released it as a single in the US and Japan in the summer of 1989. The single peaked at number 89 on the Billboard Hot 100 and at number 16 on the Adult Contemporary charts. This was Astley's last single with producers Stock Aitken Waterman.  On New Year's Eve 2019, Astley performed the song with YolanDa Brown on the BBC's Jools' Annual Hootenanny.

* 4 – YolanDa Brown, British saxophonist and composer.

January 2020 the band made their debut UK TV appearance as guests on CBeebies show “YolanDa’s Band Jam”. Hosted by YolanDa Brown, the show consists of YolanDa inviting musical guests to play along with a live audience of children aged five to seven.

The awards ceremony on 10 December was held at The O2 Arena in Greenwich. The hosts for this event were Emily Atack and Russell Kane; the confirmed line up performing on the night included Labrinth, Maverick Sabre, Stooshe, McFly, Noisettes, YolanDa Brown, Diversity and Angel.

* Managed YolanDa Brown, the British jazz saxophonist and composer. YolanDa became the first artist to win the MOBO Award for "Best Jazz Act" across two consecutive years. In 2012 she launched her debut album on the Black Grape Records label which peaked at Number 1 on both the UK iTunes and Amazon Jazz charts.

* Launched the Black Grape Music Venue and Gastro Bar, a joint venture between Adetokunbo T Oyelola, Eddie Kadi, Charlie Kenny and YolanDa Brown. The venue was officially unveiled to the public in the autumn of 2009 and featured African-Caribbean cuisine.
This record label was launched with the release of "April Showers May Flowers", an album by YolanDa Brown, in February 2012.

Twinkl offered all its resources for free to parents, teachers and carers globally during the Coronavirus school closures. Twinkl, kids creative-media agency SUPER. and YolanDa Brown supported teachers and parents when the United Kingdom went into lockdown and schools across the country closed in January 2021. Twinkl offered a selection of free teaching resources and home-learning packs.
